content.question: A manufacturer of computer monitors estimates that 4 percent of all the monitors manufactured have a screen defect. Let <math alttext="P sub d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the population proportion of all monitors manufactured that have a screen defect. For the sampling distribution of the sample proportion for samples of size 100, <math alttext="mu sub P hat sub d equals 0.04" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.04</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is the best interpretation of <math alttext="mu sub P hat sub d equals 0.04" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.04</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: For all samples of size 100, the mean of all possible sample proportions of monitors manufactured that have a screen defect is 0.04.
For all samples of size 100, the standard deviation of all possible sample proportions of monitors manufactured that have a screen defect is 0.04.
For a randomly selected screen monitor, the probability that the selected monitor will have a screen defect is 0.04.
For each sample of size 100, the proportion of monitors manufactured that will have a screen defect is 0.04.
For a randomly selected screen monitor, the mean number of defects for the monitor will be equal to 4.

content.answer: For all samples of size 100, the mean of all possible sample proportions of monitors manufactured that have a screen defect is 0.04.

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
